DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit level
        Off [0]
    Oscillation
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Set Speed [SSPD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit level
          Off [0]
    Enable Oscillation [ENOSC]
    Disable Oscillation [DISOSC]
    Set Timer [STMR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [RPT]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the ceiling fan and set it to speed level 3 with oscillation enabled for 45 minutes?

To fulfill your request, I first identify the commands needed based on the device structure. Turning on the fan requires the Turn On [DON] command. Setting the speed to level 3 uses Set Speed [SSPD] with parameter 3, which is within the allowed range 0-5. Enabling oscillation uses Enable Oscillation [ENOSC]. Setting the timer to 45 minutes uses Set Timer [STMR] with parameter 45, which is within the 0-120 minutes range.

Step-by-step:
1. Send Turn On command to power the fan.
2. Send Set Speed command with parameter 3.
3. Send Enable Oscillation command.
4. Send Set Timer command with parameter 45.

Result: The ceiling fan will be on at speed level 3, oscillation enabled, and timer set for 45 minutes.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Consumption
      Range 0 to 500 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Set Temperature [STMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Reset Energy Usage [RESET]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RPTMP]
    Report Energy Consumption [RPEC]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the water heater temperature to 60 degrees Celsius and check how much energy it has used so far.

First, I verify the temperature range is 30 to 75 °C, so setting it to 60 °C is valid. The command to set temperature is Set Temperature [STMP] with a parameter in that range. To check energy consumption, the device supports Report Energy Consumption [RPEC].

Step-by-step:
1. Send Set Temperature command with parameter 60 °C.
2. Send Report Energy Consumption command to retrieve current usage.

Result: The water heater temperature will be set to 60 °C, and the current energy consumption will be reported.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Garage Door
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Door Status [RPTDS]
    Report Lock Status [RPTLS]

USER QUERY:
Please unlock the garage door and open it, then tell me if it is fully open.

Analyzing the device structure, unlocking the door requires the Unlock Door [UNLOCK] command, and opening the door uses Open Door [OPEN]. To verify if the door is fully open, I can use Report Door Status [RPTDS], which returns the Door Status property with possible values Closed, Open, Opening, or Closing.

Step-by-step:
1. Send Unlock Door command.
2. Send Open Door command.
3. Send Report Door Status command to check current door state.

If the reported status is 'Open' [1], the door is fully open.

Result: The garage door will be unlocked and opened, and the status report will confirm if it is fully open.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Window Blind
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Fully Closed [0]
        Fully Open [100]
    Tilt Angle
      Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Position [SPOS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Tilt [STILT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Stop Movement [STOP]
    Query Battery [QBAT]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Position [RPOS]
    Report Tilt [RTILT]
    Report Battery [RBAT]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the window blind to 75% open and tilt the slats to 30 degrees? Also, tell me the current battery level.

Reviewing the device structure, the Position property ranges from 0 to 100%, with 0% fully closed and 100% fully open. The Tilt Angle ranges from -90 to 90 degrees. Battery Level is from 0 to 100%.

Commands to use:
- Set Position [SPOS] with parameter 75.
- Set Tilt [STILT] with parameter 30.
- Query Battery [QBAT] to get current battery level.

Step-by-step:
1. Send Set Position command with 75% to open the blinds accordingly.
2. Send Set Tilt command with 30 degrees to adjust slats.
3. Send Query Battery command to retrieve battery status.

Result: The blinds will be set to 75% open, slats tilted to 30 degrees, and the current battery level will be reported.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Refrigerator
  ***Properties***
    Internal Temperature
      Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Mode
      Enum
        Normal [0]
        Eco [1]
        Vacation [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Open Door Alert [ODA]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Enable [1]
          Disable [0]
    Set Power Mode [SPM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Normal [0]
          Eco [1]
          Vacation [2]
    Query Status [QRY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RPTMP]
    Report Door Status [RPTDS]
    Report Power Mode [RPTPM]

USER QUERY:
Please set the refrigerator temperature to 4 degrees Celsius, enable the door open alert, and switch to eco power mode.

From the device structure, the Internal Temperature can be set between 1 and 10 °C, so 4 °C is valid. The command to set temperature is Set Temperature [STMP] with parameter 4. Enabling the door open alert uses Open Door Alert [ODA] with parameter Enable [1]. Switching power mode to eco uses Set Power Mode [SPM] with parameter Eco [1].

Step-by-step:
1. Send Set Temperature command with parameter 4 °C.
2. Send Open Door Alert command with parameter Enable (1).
3. Send Set Power Mode command with parameter Eco (1).

Result: The refrigerator temperature will be set to 4 °C, door open alert enabled, and power mode switched to eco.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***

  ***Properties***

      Enum
        Off [0]

      Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum

        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [STZ]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 6 Unit zone
    Stop Zone [SPZ]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 6 Unit zone
    Set Duration [SDUR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 120 Unit minutes
    Enable Schedule [ENSC]
    Disable Schedule [DISSC]
    Query Status [QRY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Zone Status [RZST]
    Report Schedule Status [RSSC]

USER QUERY:
Start watering zone 3 for 30 minutes and enable the schedule.

The device supports starting a zone with Start Zone [STZ] command, which requires a zone number between 1 and 6. Setting watering duration uses Set Duration [SDUR] with a parameter from 1 to 120 minutes. Enabling the schedule uses Enable Schedule [ENSC].

Step-by-step:
1. Send Set Duration command with parameter 30 minutes.
2. Send Start Zone command with parameter 3.
3. Send Enable Schedule command.

Result: Zone 3 will start watering for 30 minutes, and the schedule will be enabled.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Range 1 to 4 Unit level
    Filter Life
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 4 Unit level
    Reset Filter [RFLT]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Filter Life [RFLT]
    Report Fan Speed [RFS]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the air purifier, set the fan speed to maximum, and tell me the remaining filter life.

According to the device structure, turning on the purifier uses Turn On [DON]. Fan speed can be set from 1 to 4; maximum speed is 4, so Set Fan Speed [SFS] with parameter 4 is appropriate. To get remaining filter life, Report Filter Life [RFLT] is used.

Step-by-step:
1. Send Turn On command.
2. Send Set Fan Speed command with parameter 4.
3. Send Report Filter Life command to retrieve remaining filter life percentage.

Result: The air purifier will be on at maximum fan speed, and the current filter life percentage will be reported.

Please turn on the pool heater and set the water temperature to 28 degrees Celsius. Also, tell me the current energy usage.

The device allows turning the heater on with Turn Heater On [DON]. The water temperature can be set between 10 and 40 °C; 28 °C is valid. Setting temperature uses Set Temperature [STMP] with parameter 28. To get current energy usage, Report Energy Usage [RPEU] is used.

Step-by-step:
1. Send Turn Heater On command.
2. Send Set Temperature command with parameter 28 °C.
3. Send Report Energy Usage command to retrieve current kWh consumption.

Result: The pool heater will be on with water temperature set to 28 °C, and current energy usage will be reported.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Oven
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 50 to 300 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Bake [1]
        Broil [2]
        Roast [3]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 50 to 300 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SMOD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Bake [1]
          Broil [2]
          Roast [3]
    Set Timer [STMR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
    Turn Off [DOF]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [RPT]

USER QUERY:
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius in bake mode and set a timer for 45 minutes.

The oven temperature can be set between 50 and 300 °C; 180 °C is valid. The mode can be set to Bake [1]. Timer range is 0 to 180 minutes; 45 minutes is valid.

Commands to use:
- Set Temperature [STMP] with parameter 180.
- Set Mode [SMOD] with parameter Bake (1).
- Set Timer [STMR] with parameter 45.

Step-by-step:
1. Send Set Temperature command with 180 °C.
2. Send Set Mode command with Bake mode.
3. Send Set Timer command with 45 minutes.

Result: The oven will preheat to 180 °C in bake mode with a 45-minute timer set.
